title: Bag O' Links - 25/1/2010
layout: post
---

* "Rails 3 - ActionMailer's new API":http://lindsaar.net/2010/1/26/new-actionmailer-api-in-rails-3 - A brief overview on the new mailer API. another thing changed.
* "Data.gov":http://www.data.gov/ - The purpose of Data.gov is to increase public access to high value, machine readable datasets generated by the Executive Branch of the Federal Government. Eat that lorem ipsum.
* "Use CloudFront when you need to":http://www.icoretech.org/2010/01/use-amazon-cloudfront-when-appropriate/ - a no-use case by the guys behind "AudioBox":http://audiobox.fm, which is very cool on it's own.
* "How to work with a lawyer on a startup":http://www.cloudave.com/link/how-to-work-with-lawyers-at-a-startup - and i add "with a close by shotgun".
* "A successful Git branching model":http://nvie.com/archives/323 - or, how to make your team work well under a Git umbrella.
* "Search fundamentals: basic indexing":http://www.skorks.com/2010/01/search-fundamentals-basic-indexing/ - not database indexing, but data indexing. although most of us don't write web crawlers for fun and profit, i am pretty sure those methods will come handy some day.
* "Getting up to speed with Rails 3":http://darwinweb.net/articles/82 - it's almost here, here's how to play with it now.
* "UTC vs Ruby, ActiveRecord, Sinatra, Heroku and Postgres":http://pivotallabs.com/users/alex/blog/articles/1142-utc-vs-ruby-activerecord-sinatra-heroku-and-postgres - Don't we all love Time and Date ? 
* "Getting non-rational with MongoDB":http://rubyconf2009.confreaks.com/19-nov-2009-16-20-getting-non-relational-with-mongodb-michael-dirolf.html - Screencast from the latest RubyConf.
* "font-face and browser support":http://www.evotech.net/blog/2010/01/font-face-browser-support-tutorial/ - get in my browser already!. really, that's probably the thing i look forward the most.
* "don't use try-catch":http://codebetter.com/blogs/karlseguin/archive/2010/01/25/don-t-use-try-catch.aspx - it seems not to be a language specific issue, people use exceptions when they shouldn't.
* "CSS3's new shiny visuals":http://www.smashingmagazine.com/2010/01/25/the-new-hotness-using-css3-visual-effects/ - have fun.
* "Reflections from 'The Compleat Rubyist'":http://blog.rubybestpractices.com/posts/gregory/014-the-compleat-rubyist.html - seems like it was fun, how come i didn't know about it :(.
* "Design your application for a cloud deployment":http://gojko.net/2010/01/25/designing-applications-for-cloud-deployment/ - good tips.
* "Managed hosting for CouchDB":http://hosting.couch.io/ - they haz one.
* "Rapid application deployment with Git":http://guides.webbynode.com/articles/readystacks/rapid-apps.html - good to see that Webbynode are bringing their article base to Slicehost's level, aside from that, they did something really cool here :)
* "ActiveRecord 3.0 goes wild":http://m.onkey.org/2010/1/22/active-record-query-interface - looks neat, not going to be so-much-fun upgrading 2.x apps down the road.
* "CSS pseudo - know them!":http://webtint.net/tutorials/the-mysterious-pseudo-class-in-css/ - a list, a browser support table, all the fun in one article.
* "RVM - just do it":http://casperfabricius.com/site/2010/01/24/multiple-ruby-versions-with-rvm/ - having multiple versions of ruby on your machine, the easy way.
* "Better javascript Classes":http://webreflection.blogspot.com/2010/01/better-javascript-classes.html - know your ways, oh great javascript warrior.
* "Rails != Scaffolding":http://www.ultrasaurus.com/sarahblog/2009/01/scaffolds-rails/ - personal opinion: scaffolding should die. Sarah puts it in nicer words :).
* "Automate actions on MacOS":http://groups.csail.mit.edu/uid/sikuli/ - Automator, you are worthless from now on.

h4. Treasures

* "NavLinks":http://github.com/ratnikov/navlinks - an easy way to create navigation links for your Rails application.
* "MagickInstaller":http://github.com/maddox/magick-installer/blob/master/magick-installer.sh - a script that installs Rmagick on MacOS (L/SL). supposed to be kept up to date with versions.
* "SlimScrooge":http://github.com/sdsykes/slim_scrooge - another ActiveRecord optimizer.
* "TemplateInliner":http://github.com/acunote/template_inliner - and an ActionView optimizer!.
